qas.question: On Twitter what famous person condemned Hopkins' remarks?
Who wrote critically in The Independent about Hopkins?
With whom did Usborne draw parallels to Hopkins as a result of Hopkins' comments?

answers.text: previous uses by the Nazis and just before the Rwandan Genocide by its perpetrators

qas.question: Which writer in The Guardian was critical of Hopkins?
What did Williams say should be done about Hopkins?

answers.text: I’m not saying gag her: I’m saying fight her

context: Hopkins' column also drew criticism on Twitter, including from <a0_0>Russell Brand<a0_0/>, to whom Hopkins responded by accusing Brand's "champagne socialist humanity" of neglecting taxpayers. <a1_0>Simon Usborne<a1_0/>, writing in The Independent, compared her use of the word "cockroach" to <a2_0>previous uses by the Nazis and just before the Rwandan Genocide by its perpetrators<a2_0/>. He suspected that if any other contributor had written the piece it would not have been published and questioned her continued employment by the newspaper. <a3_0>Zoe Williams<a3_0/> commented in The Guardian: "It is no joke when people start talking like this. We are not 'giving her what she wants' when we make manifest our disgust. It is not a free speech issue. <a4_0>I’m not saying gag her: I’m saying fight her<a4_0/>".
